data.title: the boys
data.meta_description: THE BOYS definition: 1. a group of male friends:  2. an approving way of speaking about your country's soldiers:  3. a…. Learn more.
data.text:
phrase [ plural ]

B2

He used to like spending Friday nights with the boys.

Chris is out with the boys.

I might bring the boys back here after the game if that's all right.

I think I'll join the boys for a drink later.

You wait till I tell the boys that.

He'll probably watch the game with the boys.

Dan usually gets together with the boys on a Thursday evening.

B2 (also our boys)

an approving way of speaking about your country's soldiers:

There have been lots of calls to bring the boys home.

I'm glad it isn't me sending our boys to war.

I just think we should do more to support our boys.

We have to send a message to our leaders that enough is enough and we need to bring our boys home now.

See also

(Definition of the boys from the Cambridge Advanced Learner's Dictionary & Thesaurus © Cambridge University Press)

Translations of the boys

in Chinese (Traditional)

男性朋友們, （對本國士兵的暱稱）子弟兵，士兵們…

in Chinese (Simplified)

男性朋友们, （对本国士兵的昵称）子弟兵，士兵们…

in Spanish

los chicos, los muchachos, nuestras tropas…

in Portuguese

os amigos, a turma, nossos meninos…
